WHY DO ENTERPRISES CHOOSE QODO?
Consistent quality across
complex codebases

Accelerate delivery and maintain rigorous standards with Qodo’s enterprise-grade code review platform

Scale Delivery Without Adding Risk

Automate reviews and eliminate bottlenecks so your teams ship 2–4× faster. Free senior engineers from repetitive validation and reduce cycle times across every team.

Improve Reliability & Catch Issues Early

Qodo identifies logic errors, regressions, security concerns, and test gaps before code hits production. Less rework, fewer incidents, more confidence in every release.

Built-in Standards for Distributed Codebases

Qodo understands your entire codebase across services and repos. It detects drift, enforces patterns, and ensures every change aligns with your architectural and compliance rules.

Secure, Private, and Enterprise-Ready

SOC2-ready security, air-gapped/on-prem deployment, scoped context access, full auditability, and zero external data exposure. Adopt AI safely with complete control.

BROWSE ALL POSTS
Q&A
Questions?
What makes Qodo the best choice for enterprise-size teams?

Qodo is built for scale, complexity, and governance – everything enterprise teams need that point solutions overlook.

Context-aware agents, not autocomplete: Qodo goes beyond code suggestions with multi-step, agentic workflows that adapt to your codebase, tools, and standards.
Secure by design: scoped context access, SOC 2 compliance, and flexible deployment options (including VPC and air-gapped environments) ensure your code and data stay protected.
Deep integration with your stack: native plugins for JetBrains and VS Code, GitHub/GitLab integration, and support for CI/CD workflows make Qodo a natural fit – not a bolt-on.
Standards enforcement at scale: codify and apply your organization’s best practices across reviews, tests, and code generation to ensure consistency across teams.
Customizable and extensible: with support for the Model Context Protocol (MCP), you can connect Qodo to tools like Jira, internal APIs, and more—without losing control.

In short: Qodo doesn’t just help developers move faster. It helps enterprise teams build better software with consistency, confidence, and context.

How is Qodo different from GitHub Copilot or other AI tools?

Most tools offer autocomplete. Qodo offers agentic workflows, context-aware code reviews, automated test generation, and deep IDE and Git integrations – so you get quality, not just speed.

What is Agent Mode and how does it work?

Agent Mode enables Qodo to break down complex tasks into multi-step actions: selecting tools, gathering context, and solving problems end-to-end. It’s ideal for feature implementation, debugging, and working from tickets or stories.

Can I control what Qodo sees in my codebase?

Yes. With Qodo’s scoped indexing and permission-aware context engine, you can define exactly what parts of your codebase the AI can access, down to the repo, folder, or file level.

Do we need to change our workflows to adopt Qodo?

Not at all. Qodo integrates directly with JetBrains, VS Code, GitHub, GitLab, and CI/CD tools. You can layer it into your existing workflows without disrupting how your team builds today.

Does Qodo support on-premises or private deployment?

Yes. Qodo supports multiple deployment models, including on-premises, VPC, and air-gapped environments, depending on your security requirements.

How does Qodo handle security and compliance?

Qodo is SOC 2 compliant, encrypts all data in transit, and only analyzes the code and metadata explicitly permitted by your configuration. No code is used for training.

Can we customize Qodo to reflect our coding standards?

Yes. You can define and embed best practices into Qodo’s agents, so every review, test, and suggestion aligns with your organization’s standards.

How do we get started with Qodo for our team?

Simply book a demo! We’ll help you scope your goals, set up integrations, and get Qodo aligned with your workflows and codebase.

Qodo is an AI code review platform that brings automated, context-aware review into your IDE, pull requests, CI/CD, and Git workflows (GitHub, GitLab). It’s built for complex codebases, with context across multi-repos, to surface critical issues early, enforce standards, shorten feedback cycles, and ship better code faster. In Qodo, AI code review, code quality, and SDLC governance come together in one platform for teams that care as much about how code is reviewed as how fast it ships.

<section class="block-ds ds-block-review-process -wrapper -mb-default -pb-default">
		<header class="ds-section-header ds-block-review-process__header ">
					<span class="ds-section-header__label -caption">
				Why do Enterprises Choose Qodo?			</span>
		
					<div class="ds-section-header__content -body-large">
				<h2>Consistent quality across<br>
complex codebases</h2>
<p>Accelerate delivery and maintain rigorous standards with Qodo’s enterprise-grade code review platform</p>
			</div>
			</header>
	
	
			<div class="ds-block-review-process__tiles -count-4">
							<div class="ds-block-review-process__tile -body-medium">
					<h3>Scale Delivery Without Adding Risk</h3>
<p>Automate reviews and eliminate bottlenecks so your teams ship 2–4× faster. Free senior engineers from repetitive validation and reduce cycle times across every team.</p>
				</div>
							<div class="ds-block-review-process__tile -body-medium">
					<h3>Improve Reliability & Catch Issues Early</h3>
<p>Qodo identifies logic errors, regressions, security concerns, and test gaps before code hits production. Less rework, fewer incidents, more confidence in every release.</p>
				</div>
							<div class="ds-block-review-process__tile -body-medium">
					<h3>Built-in Standards for Distributed Codebases</h3>
<p>Qodo understands your entire codebase across services and repos. It detects drift, enforces patterns, and ensures every change aligns with your architectural and compliance rules.</p>
				</div>
							<div class="ds-block-review-process__tile -body-medium">
					<h3>Secure, Private, and Enterprise-Ready</h3>
<p>SOC2-ready security, air-gapped/on-prem deployment, scoped context access, full auditability, and zero external data exposure. Adopt AI safely with complete control.</p>
				</div>
					</div>
	</section>

<section class="block-acf ds-block ds-block-faq -mb-default -wrapper">

	<header class="ds-section-header -align-left">
					<span class="ds-section-header__label -caption">
				Q&A			</span>
		
					<div class="ds-section-header__content -body-large">
				<h2>Questions?</h2>
			</div>
			</header>
			<div class="ds-block-faq__faqs">
							<div class="ds-block-faq__item" data-item="">
					<button class="ds-block-faq__title" id="ds-block-faq-button-0" type="button" data-button="" aria-controls="ds-block-faq-panel-0" aria-expanded="false">
						What makes Qodo the best choice for enterprise-size teams?					</button>
					<div class="ds-block-faq__answer" id="ds-block-faq-panel-0" aria-labelledby="ds-block-faq-button-0" aria-hidden="true" hidden="" data-panel="">
						<div class="ds-block-faq__answer-container">
							<p>Qodo is built for scale, complexity, and governance – everything enterprise teams need that point solutions overlook.</p>
<ul>
<li>Context-aware agents, not autocomplete: Qodo goes beyond code suggestions with multi-step, <a class="wpil_keyword_link" title="agentic workflows" href="https://www.qodo.ai/blog/agentic-workflows-in-ai-development/" data-wpil-keyword-link="linked" data-wpil-replace="">agentic workflows</a> that adapt to your codebase, tools, and standards.</li>
<li>Secure by design: scoped context access, SOC 2 compliance, and flexible deployment options (including VPC and air-gapped environments) ensure your code and data stay protected.</li>
<li>Deep integration with your stack: native plugins for JetBrains and VS Code, GitHub/GitLab integration, and support for CI/CD workflows make Qodo a natural fit – not a bolt-on.</li>
<li>Standards enforcement at scale: codify and apply your organization’s best practices across reviews, tests, and code generation to ensure consistency across teams.</li>
<li>Customizable and extensible: with support for the Model Context Protocol (MCP), you can connect Qodo to tools like Jira, internal APIs, and more—without losing control.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>In short:</strong> Qodo doesn’t just help developers move faster. It helps enterprise teams build better software with consistency, confidence, and context.</p>
						</div>
					</div>
				</div>
							<div class="ds-block-faq__item" data-item="">
					<button class="ds-block-faq__title" id="ds-block-faq-button-1" type="button" data-button="" aria-controls="ds-block-faq-panel-1" aria-expanded="false">
						How is Qodo different from GitHub Copilot or other AI tools?					</button>
					<div class="ds-block-faq__answer" id="ds-block-faq-panel-1" aria-labelledby="ds-block-faq-button-1" aria-hidden="true" hidden="" data-panel="">
						<div class="ds-block-faq__answer-container">
							<p>Most tools offer autocomplete. Qodo offers agentic workflows, context-aware code reviews, automated test generation, and deep IDE and Git integrations – so you get quality, not just speed.</p>
						</div>
					</div>
				</div>
							<div class="ds-block-faq__item" data-item="">
					<button class="ds-block-faq__title" id="ds-block-faq-button-2" type="button" data-button="" aria-controls="ds-block-faq-panel-2" aria-expanded="false">
						What is Agent Mode and how does it work?					</button>
					<div class="ds-block-faq__answer" id="ds-block-faq-panel-2" aria-labelledby="ds-block-faq-button-2" aria-hidden="true" hidden="" data-panel="">
						<div class="ds-block-faq__answer-container">
							<p>Agent Mode enables Qodo to break down complex tasks into multi-step actions: selecting tools, gathering context, and solving problems end-to-end. It’s ideal for feature implementation, debugging, and working from tickets or stories.</p>
						</div>
					</div>
				</div>
							<div class="ds-block-faq__item" data-item="">
					<button class="ds-block-faq__title" id="ds-block-faq-button-3" type="button" data-button="" aria-controls="ds-block-faq-panel-3" aria-expanded="false">
						Can I control what Qodo sees in my codebase?					</button>
					<div class="ds-block-faq__answer" id="ds-block-faq-panel-3" aria-labelledby="ds-block-faq-button-3" aria-hidden="true" hidden="" data-panel="">
						<div class="ds-block-faq__answer-container">
							<p>Yes. With Qodo’s scoped indexing and permission-aware context engine, you can define exactly what parts of your codebase the AI can access, down to the repo, folder, or file level.</p>
						</div>
					</div>
				</div>
							<div class="ds-block-faq__item" data-item="">
					<button class="ds-block-faq__title" id="ds-block-faq-button-4" type="button" data-button="" aria-controls="ds-block-faq-panel-4" aria-expanded="false">
						Do we need to change our workflows to adopt Qodo?					</button>
					<div class="ds-block-faq__answer" id="ds-block-faq-panel-4" aria-labelledby="ds-block-faq-button-4" aria-hidden="true" hidden="" data-panel="">
						<div class="ds-block-faq__answer-container">
							<p>Not at all. Qodo integrates directly with JetBrains, VS Code, GitHub, GitLab, and CI/CD tools. You can layer it into your existing workflows without disrupting how your team builds today.</p>
						</div>
					</div>
				</div>
							<div class="ds-block-faq__item" data-item="">
					<button class="ds-block-faq__title" id="ds-block-faq-button-5" type="button" data-button="" aria-controls="ds-block-faq-panel-5" aria-expanded="false">
						Does Qodo support on-premises or private deployment?					</button>
					<div class="ds-block-faq__answer" id="ds-block-faq-panel-5" aria-labelledby="ds-block-faq-button-5" aria-hidden="true" hidden="" data-panel="">
						<div class="ds-block-faq__answer-container">
							<p>Yes. Qodo supports multiple deployment models, including on-premises, VPC, and air-gapped environments, depending on your security requirements.</p>
						</div>
					</div>
				</div>
							<div class="ds-block-faq__item" data-item="">
					<button class="ds-block-faq__title" id="ds-block-faq-button-6" type="button" data-button="" aria-controls="ds-block-faq-panel-6" aria-expanded="false">
						How does Qodo handle security and compliance?					</button>
					<div class="ds-block-faq__answer" id="ds-block-faq-panel-6" aria-labelledby="ds-block-faq-button-6" aria-hidden="true" hidden="" data-panel="">
						<div class="ds-block-faq__answer-container">
							<p>Qodo is SOC 2 compliant, encrypts all data in transit, and only analyzes the code and metadata explicitly permitted by your configuration. No code is used for training.</p>
						</div>
					</div>
				</div>
							<div class="ds-block-faq__item" data-item="">
					<button class="ds-block-faq__title" id="ds-block-faq-button-7" type="button" data-button="" aria-controls="ds-block-faq-panel-7" aria-expanded="false">
						Can we customize Qodo to reflect our coding standards?					</button>
					<div class="ds-block-faq__answer" id="ds-block-faq-panel-7" aria-labelledby="ds-block-faq-button-7" aria-hidden="true" hidden="" data-panel="">
						<div class="ds-block-faq__answer-container">
							<p>Yes. You can define and embed best practices into Qodo’s agents, so every review, test, and suggestion aligns with your organization’s standards.</p>
						</div>
					</div>
				</div>
							<div class="ds-block-faq__item" data-item="">
					<button class="ds-block-faq__title" id="ds-block-faq-button-8" type="button" data-button="" aria-controls="ds-block-faq-panel-8" aria-expanded="false">
						How do we get started with Qodo for our team?					</button>
					<div class="ds-block-faq__answer" id="ds-block-faq-panel-8" aria-labelledby="ds-block-faq-button-8" aria-hidden="true" hidden="" data-panel="">
						<div class="ds-block-faq__answer-container">
							<p>Simply <a href="https://www.qodo.ai/book-a-demo/">book a demo!</a> We’ll help you scope your goals, set up integrations, and get Qodo aligned with your workflows and codebase.</p>
						</div>
					</div>
				</div>
					</div>

			skipLink;

		// Early exit if a skip-link target can't be located.
		if ( ! skipLinkTarget ) {
			return;
		}

		/*
		 * Get the site wrapper.
		 * The skip-link will be injected in the beginning of it.
		 */
		sibling = document.querySelector( '.wp-site-blocks' );

		// Early exit if the root element was not found.
		if ( ! sibling ) {
			return;

			skipLinkTargetID = 'wp--skip-link--target';

		skipLink.id = 'wp-skip-link';
		skipLink.href = '#' + skipLinkTargetID;
		skipLink.innerText = 'Skip to content';

		// Inject the skip link.
		sibling.parentElement.insertBefore( skipLink, sibling );
	}() );
